title: Estimation of financial needs and condition of infrastructure objects
text:
Problem statement
Proper management of infrastructure requires forecasting the condition of infrastructure assets and the level of funding required to ensure that they provide an adequate level of service, with due consideration of the associated uncertainties. In this project, you will make these estimates for the railway infrastructure network of the SZU. You will estimate how the condition of the existing network will change over the next 50 years, propose possible infrastructure interventions to maintain an adequate level of service, and estimate the cost of these interventions. In this project you will learn to:

Organize the available data of an infrastructure network,
Evaluate the impact of individual objects on the overall level of service,
Develop models for the condition of individual objects, as well as how they change over time, and
Develop and evaluate interventions for infrastructure networks considering data uncertainty.

Here we upload the slides related to each weekly meeting according to the Figure 1.

    dateFormat  YYYY-MM-DD

    Kick-off meeting : milestone, a1, 2024-02-26, 1d
    
    section Work in progress
    Determine objective functions and classify assets :done a1, 2024-03-05,5d
    Define condition classes and model deterioration : 6d
    Determine possible interventions & strategies : 12d
    Estimate cost of interventions and their impacts : 12d
    Interim presentation :crit, 2024-04-08, 1d
    Determine optimal interventioin strategy : 14d
    Develop intervention program : 21d
    Review results and any assumptions : 14d
    Final presentation :crit, 2024-05-27, 1d
    
    section Finalisation
    Document work incl. meeting minutes, final report, etc. :active a2,  2024-03-04, 12w
    Material submission : milestone, 2024-05-31, 1d
    




Figure 1: The timeline for accomplishing the thesis.

Estimation of financial needs and condition of infrastructure assets



Week2









Mar 5, 2024


Hamed Mehranfar, Yushu An

title: Determine objective function and classify assets
text:
The process used to ensure that existing infrastructure (assets and/or networks) provide adequate levels of service for specified periods of time.
To understand why the infrastructure is the way it is today, we want to know:

How many trains operate on the network? How frequent is the service?
How many passengers travel on a daily, weekly, monthly, or yearly basis? Why?
How many people or businesses are near the infrastructure?
When was the infrastructure built and/or modified in the past?
…

title: Determine objective function and classify assets
text:
What are we optimising?
To be clear what your are trying to achieve:

Identify what is important
Place values on what is important
Estimate how your planned interventions improve the situation, when compared with what would otherwise happen




  
    
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  Institut fürBau- und Infrastruktur-management

title: Determine objective function and classify assets
text:
Infrastructure management


The process used to ensure that existing infrastructure (assets and/or networks) provide adequate levels of service for specified periods of time.
To understand why the infrastructure is the way it is today, we want to know:

How many trains operate on the network? How frequent is the service?
How many passengers travel on a daily, weekly, monthly, or yearly basis? Why?
How many people or businesses are near the infrastructure?
When was the infrastructure built and/or modified in the past?
…




It requires taking into consideration the benefits and costs of infrastructure to all members of society, including economic, ecological and social benefits and costs.
It also requires balancing the need for prediction accuracy with analysis effort.

title: Determine objective function and classify assets
text:
Objective function


What are we optimising?
To be clear what your are trying to achieve:

Identify what is important
Place values on what is important
Estimate how your planned interventions improve the situation, when compared with what would otherwise happen




In order to make and defend proposals for maintenance interventions you need to be clear on what you are hoping to achieve with interventions.
What you are hoping to achieve is best expressed in terms of how humans are affected by infrastructure, either directly or indirectly.

title: Determine objective function and classify assets
text:
ASTRA - Vision statement




The vision contains the picture of the future in 2040, on which ASTRA will base its future strategic decisions.
The vision presents general directions of anticipated development that are helpful in determining strategies.
The vision is not intended to be complete.



The figure is from the strategic alignment document published by ASTRA, which is a federal authority responsible for road infrastructure and private road transport. ASTRA works closely together with cantonal, national and international partners, and formulates principles and prepares decisions for a sustainable federal road transport policy.
The vision contains a vision of the future in 2040, which is used to guide ASTRA when it is making strategic decisions. The vision contains general directions of anticipated development that are helpful in determining strategies. It is not intended to be complete.

title: Determine objective function and classify assets
text:
ASTRA - Mission statement




The mission presents how ASTRA understands its official mandate, its self-image as an institution, its customer orientation, and its ideas on internal cooperation.
The mission serves as an orientation for employees and customers as to what ASTRA stands for.



The mission explains how ASTRA sees its task as a federal agency, how it sees itself as an institution and how it sees that it is meeting clients needs and how it sees internal team work.
It helps orient term members and clients in understanding ASTRA.

title: Determine objective function and classify assets
text:
ASTRA - Guiding principles




The strategic guiding principles set out fundamental and overarching objectives of the agency with regard to private transport, the Swiss transport system in general and the national road in particular.



The guiding principles of ASTRA are used to derive the specific goals with respect to individual traffic, the Swiss transport system in general and the national road network specifically.

title: Determine objective function and classify assets
text:
ASTRA - Goals and constraints





The goals for the individual topics define what ASTRA would like to have achieved by the year 2030.
The goals are based on the “Vision 2040” and ensure that the formulated direction is taken into account.
The goals are not intended to correspond to the actual state, but to represent a challenge for ASTRA and the employees.




The goals of the individual thematic areas outline what ASTRA wants to achieve by 2030. The goals are based on the vision 2040 and are developed considering the general directions contained in the mission. The goals should not reflect the current state of affairs but should pose challenges for the ASTRA team.

title: Determine objective function and classify assets
section: ASTRA - Goals and constraints wrt. people
text:
ASTRA - Goals and constraints wrt. people



Data protection meets the requirements of society.
Driver licensing corresponds to current technical possibilities.



No more than 100 traffic fatalities and 2,500 serious injuries per year on all roads.
No more than 25 fatalities and 500 serious injuries in slow traffic per year.
The population perceives the road as attractive and safe.



Access to personal vehicles is guaranteed for all.

title: Determine objective function and classify assets
section: ASTRA - Goals and constraints wrt. infrastructure
text:
ASTRA - Goals and constraints wrt. infrastructure




The number of annual congestion hours on the national roads will be reduced by a quarter compared to 2015.
On at least 95% of the national road network, the structural condition of the infrastructure meets ASTRA’s standard.



The national road network defined on 21 June 1960 will be completed.
60% of the capacity expansion projects in the 2030 plan are at least in the execution project phase, and the capacity expansions projects in the 2040 plan are at least in the project planning phase.
The intelligence (route equipment) of the national road corresponds to what is necessary.
The standards for construction, maintenance and operation of the national road ensure high cost efficiency.

title: Determine objective function and classify assets
text:
Stakeholders and value framework



 




There are different ways to analyse stakeholders, but the analysis needs to be consistent. Being a stakeholder is time dependent.
Stakeholders are affected in different ways, attribute costs to stakeholders most directly affected. Define each so that they can be quantified. Principal stakeholders.
Measure impact through indicators. Attribute monetary values to each unit change in the values of these indicators over time.

title: Determine objective function and classify assets
text:
Stakeholders and value framework










Stakeholder group
Definition
Impact type




Owners
Persons who pay for the interventions on the infrastructure
Intervention


Users
Persons who are using the roads
Travel time  Accident  Comfort


Directly affected public
Persons who are in the vicinity of the road but are not using it
Noise


Indirectly affected public
Persons who are not in the vicinity of the road but are affected by its use
Particle emissions







Owner: Impact of executing interventions – economic impact of people performing tasks, ensuring that materials and equipment are available for use
User: Impact on the users due to the users being involved in an accident – economic impact due to injury or fatality Impact of travel condition in terms of time lost – economic impact of wasting work or leisure time travelling Impact of travelling on the users – physical impact from bruises from a bumpy ride, psychological impact of perceived probability involved in accident
DAP: Societal impact due to the directly affected public coming in contact with sound emissions
IAP: Impact on people due to the environment being impacted by particle emissions such as carbon dioxide, nitrogen monoxide, sulfur dioxide, dust, etc.
REMEMBER: pick stakeholders and impact that is significant, and quantifiable.


Adey, B.T., Burkhalter, M., & Martani, C. (2020). Defining road service to facilitate road infrastructure asset management. Infrastructure Asset Management, 7(4), pp. 240-255.

title: Determine objective function and classify assets
text:
Next steps



This week:

Describe the background information of infrastructure (asset past, present, and future)
Determine objective function

Who is affected by intervention (stakeholders)?
What is important to them (goals and constraints)?
How do you quantify their values?

Classify the assets

Next week:

Define condition classes and model deterioration





For all the assets, we have the description and condition state. Some objects are missing material information, but we will ask the students to provide assumptions for their thesis analysis. Some assets are also missing length and/or size information, again, we will ask the students to provide assumptions for the work.
